businessProfile.name: Mission Pizza Napoletana
businessProfile.address: 707 Trade St NW, Winston-Salem, NC 27101, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 707 Trade St NW, Winston-Salem, NC 27101, USA

reviews.text: My husband and I are foodies and esp pizza connoisseurs. Our favorite pizza is in Tulum called Checkpoint pizza. We haven‚Äôt found any Neapolitan pizza that is up to par until we found Mission Pizza! 10/10. We did the pizza-makase. The dough is next level. The ambiance is great. The staff is superb. Definitely recommend.

We tried the pizzakase menu (6 shared courses + wine pairing) and unfortunately left feeling very underwhelmed for the price ‚Äî our bill was $334 for two.

The concept is a play on Japanese omakase, which we were excited about, but the execution fell short. Most of the meal was predominantly bread: salad ‚Üí whole pizza ‚Üí half pizza ‚Üí pasta ‚Üí whole pizza ‚Üí dessert (two chunks of watermelon). While the food itself was okay, it wasn‚Äôt anything special, and the value just wasn‚Äôt there.

The wine pairing was disappointing, and we later realized we could have ordered everything individually from the menu for less than the set price. Service also felt awkward ‚Äî instead of thoughtful stories or inspiration for each dish (as advertised), we were just given a quick list of ingredients, with little enthusiasm. It didn‚Äôt feel like the intimate, passionate omakase-style experience it was trying to be.

They make decent pizza, but trying to deliver a tasting menu/omakase experience just isn‚Äôt their strength ‚Äî they‚Äôd be better off focusing on what they do well. To top it off, a 20% gratuity was automatically added and then we were prompted to tip on top of that. Overall, not worth the cost or the hype.

My Husband and I had the Pizzakase on Valentine‚Äôs Day. It was 8 courses and all were so delicious! I highly recommend! The pizza crust alone is easily the best I‚Äôve ever had. I can‚Äôt ever eat commercial pizza again. Reading some of the other reviews, I think some people didn‚Äôt know what to expect . It‚Äôs not your typical pizza place. We sat at the counter where we saw the food being prepared. I feel like the made the experience even more fun.

Hands down the best pizza I've ever had. Made a reservation for the Pizzakase at the counter. Getting to watch them make it and hearing their explanations on the inspiration of each dish as well as the origins of the ingredients elevated the experience even further. If it's in your budget I cannot recommend it enough. I will be coming back.

We dined as a group of 6 for the Pizzakase last evening.  I have been anticipating this experience for quite some time as were our guests. Everything exceeded our expectations. It was the perfect amount of food as we left full, but not stuffed. Great service, great banter with the chef, explaining each of the courses, all around an incredible pizza experience!

editorial_summary.overview: Wood-burning oven pies & a full menu of Italian fare in chill digs with a dine-at bar.

recentReviews.text: We were recommended this restaurant as a great place to get pizza, and wow! It was very yawn worthy. 26 dollars for a pizza that is not 12", not 16", but some random size that you can't eat by yourself nor share with anyone. If you are the type that enjoys paying triple the price you should pay, you will love the menu that is forced down your throat.. No substitutions, come on. Fennel is gross but you still make me eat it! Un b leevable

Hands down the best food around. I went to uncsa from ‚Äã2007-11 and considered Winston Salem to be a food desert. When I moved back in 2023 I was told to go to Mission not knowing what to expect. I ordered the bucatini all'amatriciana and it was so delicious I almost cried. I could not believe that I was eating something so incredible in WS - there was actual guanciale, the pasta was cooked al dente, the flavor, the temperature, the portion size, everything was perfect. Of course the pizza is fantastic, I could eat it every day, but don‚Äôt stop there ! Try the prix fixe, the pizzakase, the specials. Every ingredient is sourced thoughtfully, locally if possible, and served fresh. ‚ÄãD‚Äãon't forget to check out the Baller wine section, you‚Äôll find things there you won‚Äôt anywhere else‚Äã and sometimes they're 20% off. This place is a true gem and we are so lucky to have it in WS.

We tried the pizzakase menu (6 shared courses + wine pairing) and unfortunately left feeling very underwhelmed for the price ‚Äî our bill was $334 for two.

The concept is a play on Japanese omakase, which we were excited about, but the execution fell short. Most of the meal was predominantly bread: salad ‚Üí whole pizza ‚Üí half pizza ‚Üí pasta ‚Üí whole pizza ‚Üí dessert (two chunks of watermelon). While the food itself was okay, it wasn‚Äôt anything special, and the value just wasn‚Äôt there.

The wine pairing was disappointing, and we later realized we could have ordered everything individually from the menu for less than the set price. Service also felt awkward ‚Äî instead of thoughtful stories or inspiration for each dish (as advertised), we were just given a quick list of ingredients, with little enthusiasm. It didn‚Äôt feel like the intimate, passionate omakase-style experience it was trying to be.

They make decent pizza, but trying to deliver a tasting menu/omakase experience just isn‚Äôt their strength ‚Äî they‚Äôd be better off focusing on what they do well. To top it off, a 20% gratuity was automatically added and then we were prompted to tip on top of that. Overall, not worth the cost or the hype.
Stick with the pizza. Make sure you know what you reserved before you arrive. Forget about coffee after dinner.
Good service, great food, excellent vibe!

Racist place. Old white guy told us brown people to ‚Äúcheck your wallet‚Äù before we went inside. Then the waitress said couldn‚Äôt seat our table of 5 because too busy. But half the restaurant was empty.

I very rarely do a review , but it‚Äôs not often I feel cheated by a reasturant. My husbands friend recommended, they had pizzacase, (a take on Japanese omakase) and a 4 course menu for $50 per person, wasn‚Äôt all pizzas they said. )
Any tasting menu I have had (which is many) you each get an individual serving. So first course comes, it‚Äôs nice size bowl of tomatoes , they then came with 3 plates , suddenly didn‚Äôt look like such a big bowl for 3. We thought maybe an extra course or amuse bush. Then they bring a very small bowl of mussels , thought 2 more were coming , but no. I counted , there were 7 mussels for 3 people. And we just got back from Europe where a serving was prob 30 or so mussels for one person. We still thought maybe that was an extra little bite. Now we‚Äôre starting to wonder did that count as 2 courses ? We said no , or assumed there were going to be at least 2 pizzas and a big main dish.
They bring out a individual plate with barely a half chicken on it , but at least we were each getting a plate of chicken. So we thought , that was for the 3 of us. I even asked how do we share this ? It was served as one piece of chicken on the bone. And big surprise, only one pizza .
I‚Äôm on zepbound , my husband barely eats my son eats a lot . We were all starving , the tiny pizza was the biggest thing they gave us . So they changed $150 plus tax and tip for 1 bowl of tomatoes, 7 mussels , 1 pizza and a piece of chicken. Which were all on the menu. So $150 for  $100 worth of food barely . We then ordered a pasta which was actually terrible, they were going for al dente , but if you cut noodle they were not cooked at all. The noodles are raw . And we were expecting some kind of truffle/parma something pizza. It was pepperoni pizza. Maybe if we just shared a pizza and a salad we would of thought it was fine . At almost $300 we left hungry and mad . It just wasn‚Äôt right .
Just ate a pizza late night its great!

detailedReviews.author: Paige O'Byrne
detailedReviews.text: We were recommended this restaurant as a great place to get pizza, and wow! It was very yawn worthy. 26 dollars for a pizza that is not 12", not 16", but some random size that you can't eat by yourself nor share with anyone. If you are the type that enjoys paying triple the price you should pay, you will love the menu that is forced down your throat.. No substitutions, come on. Fennel is gross but you still make me eat it! Un b leevable

detailedReviews.author: Carmine Cupani
detailedReviews.text: Stick with the pizza. Make sure you know what you reserved before you arrive. Forget about coffee after dinner.

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Williamson
detailedReviews.text: Good service, great food, excellent vibe!

detailedReviews.author: M. D.
detailedReviews.text: Racist place. Old white guy told us brown people to ‚Äúcheck your wallet‚Äù before we went inside. Then the waitress said couldn‚Äôt seat our table of 5 because too busy. But half the restaurant was empty.

detailedReviews.author: Jed Glazer
detailedReviews.text:
I very rarely do a review , but it‚Äôs not often I feel cheated by a reasturant. My husbands friend recommended, they had pizzacase, (a take on Japanese omakase) and a 4 course menu for $50 per person, wasn‚Äôt all pizzas they said. )
Any tasting menu I have had (which is many) you each get an individual serving. So first course comes, it‚Äôs nice size bowl of tomatoes , they then came with 3 plates , suddenly didn‚Äôt look like such a big bowl for 3. We thought maybe an extra course or amuse bush. Then they bring a very small bowl of mussels , thought 2 more were coming , but no. I counted , there were 7 mussels for 3 people. And we just got back from Europe where a serving was prob 30 or so mussels for one person. We still thought maybe that was an extra little bite. Now we‚Äôre starting to wonder did that count as 2 courses ? We said no , or assumed there were going to be at least 2 pizzas and a big main dish.
They bring out a individual plate with barely a half chicken on it , but at least we were each getting a plate of chicken. So we thought , that was for the 3 of us. I even asked how do we share this ? It was served as one piece of chicken on the bone. And big surprise, only one pizza .
I‚Äôm on zepbound , my husband barely eats my son eats a lot . We were all starving , the tiny pizza was the biggest thing they gave us . So they changed $150 plus tax and tip for 1 bowl of tomatoes, 7 mussels , 1 pizza and a piece of chicken. Which were all on the menu. So $150 for  $100 worth of food barely . We then ordered a pasta which was actually terrible, they were going for al dente , but if you cut noodle they were not cooked at all. The noodles are raw . And we were expecting some kind of truffle/parma something pizza. It was pepperoni pizza. Maybe if we just shared a pizza and a salad we would of thought it was fine . At almost $300 we left hungry and mad . It just wasn‚Äôt right .

detailedReviews.author: Tigga Ty
detailedReviews.text: Just ate a pizza late night its great!

detailedReviews.author: Dean Mericka
detailedReviews.text: We ordered just ala carte pizza and caesar. I ordered the sausage and red sauce and my wife ordered the white pizza with veggies. We had heard a lot about MPN and were excited to check out the pizza. When we ordered we asked the waiter to to ask the chef to bake our pizzas with a crispy crust. Afterall, who likes pizza that flops out of your hand when you pick it up. The waiter gave us a puzzled look and said that their pizzas were prepared by the chef to his standards. (Eg we don‚Äôt listen to our customers, the chef knows best.). When the pizza arrived it was more like wet cardboard with sauce and toppings. We asked the waiter if the chef was going to be pissed if we sent the pizzas back for more time in the oven. He hesitated and said yes, he would be. It immediately reminded us of the soup naxi on old reruns of SNL. A indignant chef with an ego and a take it or leave it attitude. I get, in highly rated restaurants, never ask for salt or modifications because the chef knows best. But geez this is a pizza restaurant selling $24 pizzas! On a positive note, the sauce and toppings were really good, but the crust was soggy, limp and too chewy. I didn‚Äôt even finish the pizza and left it‚Äôs cold limp dead crust on my plate. Way over rated.

detailedReviews.author: Veevy Nguyen
detailedReviews.text: My husband and I are foodies and esp pizza connoisseurs. Our favorite pizza is in Tulum called Checkpoint pizza. We haven‚Äôt found any Neapolitan pizza that is up to par until we found Mission Pizza! 10/10. We did the pizza-makase. The dough is next level. The ambiance is great. The staff is superb. Definitely recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Henry Harding
detailedReviews.text: All three pizzas we got were charred on the bottom and did not taste good. For the price performance everyone at the table gave it a one.

detailedReviews.author: philip green
detailedReviews.text: Bad attitude from staff. Poor description confuses clientele. Unwilling to remove an ingredient from menu item that I am allergic too and told 'Order something else or leave'

detailedReviews.author: Rachel Smith
detailedReviews.text: My husband and I are new to Winston Salem (just moved from Southern California 4 mos ago), so we have been on the lookout for great places to eat, and MPN didn‚Äôt disappoint. We went last Saturday night and sat at the counter for the Pizzakase experience. We were wowed by 8 courses served over 2 hours. Everything was exceptional, including the detailed description of what we were eating and how it was prepared. This was not just pizza. It started with a beautiful tomato salad, followed by several kinds of pizza, and also pasta, risotto balls, a ‚Äúpizza sandwich‚Äù, and a delightful peach/cherry/ricotta concoction for dessert. I give this place an ENTHUSIASTIC two thumbs up!! And, come hungry!!

detailedReviews.author: Andrea Kozak
detailedReviews.text:
First of all, the service and ambience was phenomenal. Our server  explained each course of the prix fixe in depth & answered any questions we had. The first appetizer (we ordered one prior to choosing the prix fixe route) was amazing, and the first 2 courses were very good. The peaches , tomatoes and mussels were so fresh.
The pizza was too doughy imo and didn‚Äôt have enough sauce where I felt the dough over powered the course, which I was a little bummed because it did sound like a great pizza. The dessert was just mid.

Would definitely like to try other pizzas on the menu and more of the seafood options.

detailedReviews.author: Zgriffin
detailedReviews.text: We went in around 5:30 with my fianc√© and got the prix fixe our service was phenomenal and our waitress was incredibly knowledgeable on all of our courses. All of our courses were great aside from, funny enough, the pizza was just not great. I expected more as we enjoyed the rest of the courses. If I were to go back I would select a pasta dish along with another pizza to see if it was maybe the chefs choice of that day.

detailedReviews.author: AmyBeth Drake DeWitt
detailedReviews.text:
I‚Äôm saddened by the owners reply to my deceased son‚Äôs girlfriend who recently gave a review of this establishment!
She not only told the absolute truth but she also gave credit where it was due as in the Hostess who in all truthfulness was/is a glorified bus person! She gets the least amount of $ and does twice the work! I know I was one at Ted‚Äôs Montana Grill!
But I‚Äôm flabbergasted and mind blown still at this owner, Peyton! Can you say Petty? Every word my sweet girl said who came down from Pittsburgh PA to visit us and my Mother chose this Pizza place as it used to be a part of the Mission across the street and therefore it was a connection to my son her grandson and his girlfriend and daughter!
Their website is ridiculous! Even I at 57 and once married to a software engineer found it to be not only difficult to understand but the rules! The regulations were more than I have seen in a rental agreement!
Peyton was rude called my stepfather rude for ‚Äúnot understanding his own reservation!‚Äù He proceeded to make all of us at the table of 5 very uncomfortable! Most importantly the 9 year old with us!
Again as my sweetheart of a Yankee said the Hostess was amazing and the food ehh I have certainly had better and wasn‚Äôt made to feel ‚Äúignorant‚Äù and I could go on but as she put it so eloquently ‚Äúso much for our southern hospitality!‚Äù Thanks ‚ÄúPeyton‚Äù really gave Winston-Salem a bad taste in 5 people‚Äôs mouth and you sir still got your payment!
Btw folks if you call to make a reservation as is required for parties over 4 be ready for a hefty deposit on your credit/debit card!
Amy
Madison NC
#gosteelers

detailedReviews.author: Miyu Chan
detailedReviews.text: Y'all.. This is literally the BEST pizzeria in the the entire South East and for good reason. They have won multiple awards for best pizza restaurant. (Look it up if you don't believe me!) Highly recommend doing the "Pizzakase", it is truly a unique, one of a kind experience. ‚ù§Ô∏èüî• You are sorely missing out of you haven't eaten at MPN. I only wish everyone could experience the food here! üçïü§§

detailedReviews.author: A D
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôll start by saying the food itself was great! The restaurant is beautiful, small and personal. We are visiting from out of state and this was our first night out in the area. We made a reservation online, this is where we ran into our first issue. The website was hard to navigate for my friend‚Äôs grandfather and after putting down +$200 for our reservation we got there and realized we had reserved a tasting menu. We asked if we could switch the reservation to ordering off of the menu instead and the hostess said absolutely and immediately accommodated the request. She did not say anything about food being already prepared or that it would be an inconvenience in any way. If we had known, we would have stuck with what we paid for. Payton, the owner, came up to us and yelled at us. He called us rude for not understanding what we reserved and proceeded to berate my friend‚Äôs grandfather. We considered leaving despite having already ordered, but as a veteran he said he had never walked out on anything and he didn‚Äôt plan to start tonight. We will never be back and I was very disappointed with my first experience in Winston-Salem. Not the ‚Äúsouthern hospitality‚Äù we expected.

detailedReviews.author: Ian Luecht
detailedReviews.text:
Wonderfully good I'll say.  My wife and I were able to visit for a date night out and finally caught it on a day they're open (they're closed Monday and Tuesday when we always seem to want to go in the past).

Food:
So we had a salad, 2 pizzas, and a dessert wanting to simply try all the things.  The salad was a burrata cheese salad that had a lemon oil dressing, the cheese and dressing were great...it looked simple but wonderfully light.  The pizzas, I did a white pizza with mushroom and my wife had the zucchini base pizza.  The pizzas were some of the best I've ever had.  The dough was very light tasting and the crust isn't one you should pass eating on, the ingredients all fresh and well prepared.  The dessert was a zippoli.....it was like a having a state fair fried doughnut but with a great caramel sauce.....just try it all.

Service:
So we ended up eating at the bar and our server was on point with recommendations and the check ins.  I forget his name now, but very nice and pleasant.

Atmosphere:
So there is a paid parking lot next to the restaurant and they'll validate your parking.  But the star off is for the size if the restaurant.....its tiny so seating is hard to get.

Everything said this is a must try place, just know if you have a large group this isn't the place for you.  Anything more than 4 people and I doubt you get seating and likely wouldn't enjoy your experience.

detailedReviews.author: Ken Hornbuckle
detailedReviews.text: Great place to dine. Food is excellent and has a soft ambiance that is inviting for a good date night or tasty bites in general.

detailedReviews.author: Ben Hutchison
detailedReviews.text: Best restaurant in Winston Salem, and one of the best pizza places on the east coast. We always enjoy the Pizzakase experience, well worth the money. Incredible food every time.

detailedReviews.author: Sabrina Ridaura
detailedReviews.text: The best pizzas in the triad.

detailedReviews.author: James Drezner
detailedReviews.text: Hands down the best pizza I've ever had. Made a reservation for the Pizzakase at the counter. Getting to watch them make it and hearing their explanations on the inspiration of each dish as well as the origins of the ingredients elevated the experience even further. If it's in your budget I cannot recommend it enough. I will be coming back.

detailedReviews.author: Francesco Monno
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza like eating in Italy!üëç

detailedReviews.author: Morgan Calhoun
detailedReviews.text: Mission is the good stuff- quality ingredients, fantastic pizza, and a conversation conducive environment. Honestly never eaten anything here that wasn‚Äôt excellent. Take your time, get the res, and for goodness sake don‚Äôt come if you‚Äôre in a rush or expecting Mission to be something it‚Äôs not.

detailedReviews.author: A E
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in the US! Reminds us of our Italy trips and truly is an Italian pizza! Creative and delicious!!! 10 stars!

detailedReviews.author: Peter Guerriero
detailedReviews.text: We had an amazing time last night with Chef Smith over his Pizzakase tasting menu. It was a fantastic dining experience getting to sit in front of the wood fired oven. Sharing stories of pizza and how Mission Pizza came to be. We had a multitude of courses including imported cheeses, Apulian tomatoes, Octopus, and local produce. All so well paired. Chef smith is a humble man with a true, honest passion for food. The service was incredible, the Negronis well made, and the wine selection is killer. Definitely would recommend the 2023 Sangiovese Ros√© that chef made in collaboration with Botanist and Barrel. Look for Maradonas face above the bar and that‚Äôs the wine! There‚Äôs no shortage of Neapolitan fare!  From one chef to another, Cheers! We hope to be back very soon.

detailedReviews.author: Josh Collins
detailedReviews.text: Was very excited to try this place for the first time. Had a late day but knew we could make it before closing time at 9pm. We got there at 8:35 and they had already locked the door and a waiter inside was telling us they were already closed. If your hours say you close at 9, don‚Äôt lock up until 9! Not sure if I want to try the place now. Cugino Forno and Mellow mushroom nearby with excellent pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Sam Griffith
detailedReviews.text: Some of the best dough I've ever had, but everything else is a letdown. Toppings, atmosphere, and service don't rise to the highs of the dough. Overall it doesn't meet the hype, but it's alright.

detailedReviews.author: chris normandeau
detailedReviews.text: I wasn‚Äôt sure expecting decent pizza in NC, let alone world class pizza.  Holy crap, this is a fantastic place!  If we‚Äôre back in Winston Salem I hope we go back here when they have a liquor license.  It is an expensive place, but I expect people are aware of that.

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth Tanner
detailedReviews.text: The best pizza I have ever had! My husband loves ALL pizza and we were told we had to make the trip to Winston Salem to try Mission Pizza. We did the "Pizzakase" multi course dining experience and we can't stop thinking about how amazing the food was! We will definitely be back.

detailedReviews.author: Adam Gilliland
detailedReviews.text: When you first walk in, it‚Äôs not horrible. It looks kinda nice however for the expensive five star restaurant of pizza with really nothing else that‚Äôs bland because that‚Äôs how Italian people like their food especially Pizza. I would give this a zero Naples Italy, where I‚Äôve had pizza taste better than this place.  And it looks like from all the reviews the owner likes to take his time refusing bad reviews more than making his restaurant look better. You go in there and it‚Äôs dark as hell if you died in there, no one would know you were dead  The waitress is the hostess, and she refused to even see anybody in an empty restaurant with only five people  Then continues to explain it will cost about $60 a person for a 4 to 5 course meal. It‚Äôs called Mission Pizza  Again, pizza restaurant. They have five beers on the menu. This is not a place to go eat pizza unless you are looking for a very weird time in a low lit red light area. Also, don‚Äôt try to go to the bathroom my buddy told me you will probably piss on yourself because it‚Äôs So dark in there and the lights don‚Äôt work properly. Before the restaurant being so expensive at it is for a personal size pizza being $24 with pretty much just cheese you can buy from the supermarket on the thin crust that you could buy, Yes, it is Neapolitan style so if you‚Äôre going there, don‚Äôt expect good tasting pizza. If you‚Äôve never had Italian pizza, you‚Äôre in for a treat. Very overpriced, Atmosphere is literally almost eating in the dark, Lacks enthusiasm or even any color besides red, at 5pm. It looks like a bar with an open kitchen.  Burke St., Pizza but with red lights. And extra seating that‚Äôs pretty much what it was. However, Burke St., Pizza taste so much better. Make sure that you go online and read their website. I have no idea how this business has stayed open since 2014. I think the owner is writing on the coattails of his awards of winning whatever he won being a chef. I also think that he bought into all these good reviews that you see on here cause there is no way that this restaurant has gotten so many good reviews for a Winston-Salem area. And if you read the good reviews, it says that a lot of college kids go there college kids can‚Äôt afford this place. Do better.

detailedReviews.author: Ted Dorsi
detailedReviews.text:
Became aware of this restaurant while watching an episode of NC Weekend on UNC TV that showcased it. We rarely (see also never) venture to ‚ÄúThe Dash‚Äù so we planned a one-day road trip to visit. The first indication that we were in for a wonderful dining experience was when I made an on-line reservation and was required to place a $60 deposit (applied to the bill at the end so don‚Äôt panic frugal friends). MPK is in the W-S downtown district where we found lots of shops and galleries to wander through-a nice surprise. MPK is very unassuming from the outside. The interior decor was sparse (by design I think) and I would describe it as a great example of modern industrial minimalism. The space was very clean and squared-away. Concrete and wood prevail in a dimly lit galley style dining space with tables along one wall and a high bar on the other that bellies up to the kitchen. This puts the focus on the wide open kitchen space where the chefs use a wood fired oven to spin their magic. The menu was limited to a few (maybe 12-15 dishes) but in my dining experience this usually translates to a truly delicious dining experience as only the freshest ingredients are being used to create the tastiest meals. Side note: restaurants with tri-fold menus should always be avoided as they very rarely (never) provide a memorable dining experience (unless you count indigestion as memorable). These days, going out to eat is a luxury and we as patrons should expect a memorable dining experience and we got exactly that at MPK. We opted to give the chef an unbridled creative license to cook for us by opting for their Prix Fixe option-5 rounds of whatever the chef wanted to make for us. We made the correct choice for the chef embarked on a quest to bombard and lambaste our taste buds. Like a well-experienced prize fighter Chef came out swinging with a selection of delicious and savory creations. Round one: Chef softened us up with a tangy and savory vinaigrette dressed greens with fresh crabmeat that dazzled. Round two: An unexpectedly delicious mushroom farro with layered flavors and perfect texture had us on the ropes. Round three: Chef had us figured out by now and he was clearly setting us up for the knockout as he hit us with a plate of steamed clams and PEI mussels in a rich, slightly spicy garlic red sauce-our knees became weak. Round four: The knock out blow came in the form of a wood fired pepperoni pizza with their ‚Äúroni butter‚Äù crust that had us staggering and we were down for the count. As we waived our white napkin in surrender our server cam to the rescue and presented us with a plate of braised, slightly candied pears on a bed of lemon panna cotta topped with toasted pine nuts. This dessert was truly a delicious way cap off the evening and revived us enough to get us back to the dressing room!
Overall our evening at MPK was exceptional. We wish more restaurants would put forth this kind of effort to elevate their product and provide patrons with food that hits both belly and soul. Hey Chef, we want a rematch!!!

detailedReviews.author: Lisa Pierce
detailedReviews.text: We have enjoyed going to MPN for dinner and have experienced the pizzakase event and on Sunday we attended pizza class.  It was such an incredible experience to watch Peyton make pizza and to learn techniques and tips from someone who is truly passionate about making incredible pizza.  If you haven‚Äôt eaten yet at MPN you are missing out on some of the best pizza this Italian New Yorker has ever had (you must get the meatballs-they are amazing).

detailedReviews.author: Allison Schweizer
detailedReviews.text: Not a lot of variety but good

detailedReviews.author: Thomas Kobylarz
detailedReviews.text: We dined as a group of 6 for the Pizzakase last evening.  I have been anticipating this experience for quite some time as were our guests. Everything exceeded our expectations. It was the perfect amount of food as we left full, but not stuffed. Great service, great banter with the chef, explaining each of the courses, all around an incredible pizza experience!

detailedReviews.author: scott shaull
detailedReviews.text:
I was in town from CA visiting my friends the Camaurs. Paul said we are going to MPN  Wednesday. The entire experience was amazing. We had the Prix Fixe. Each course was a feast for the eyes, nose and mouth. Wow! Our server made the food taste better!

Chef Peyton and team have an amazing concept for you. If you haven‚Äôt been‚Ä¶make it a priority. I felt the meal was underpriced and, ‚Äúoverdelivered,‚Äù in the most amazing way. We even took a pizza to go for a late night snack‚Ä¶amazing!

Thank you Chef!

detailedReviews.author: Paul Camaur
detailedReviews.text: I had never been to Mission Pizza until last night.  Wow!!!  What a treat!!!  The Neapolitan cuisine there was the best. The chef‚Äôs knowledge, detail and patience in food preparation is amazing.  A new favorite restaurant!  I recommend getting the chef‚Äôs tasting menu.  Crazy good!

detailedReviews.author: James Carros
detailedReviews.text: I have had pizza everywhere in the United States and in Italy, this is the best. Tonight we had four different types of pizza, home run every time!

detailedReviews.author: Taylor Williams
detailedReviews.text: Best dining experience in Winston-Salem. Pre fixe menu is absolutely untouchable as far as quality and value. Absolutely worth every penny. Peyton continues to push the boundaries of possibilities and ideas.

detailedReviews.author: Jared Arnett
detailedReviews.text: No amount of good food can make up for rude staff, confusing reservations and arrogant messaging.

detailedReviews.author: Harry Morley
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was overpriced and did not meet up with the hyped up expectation. The wine pours were minimal. Atmosphere was like eating on my patio under a bug light

detailedReviews.author: Nick Jackson
detailedReviews.text: Did the Pizzakase. One of the cooler dining experiences of my life. In a food coma after 8 delicious courses. Instantly my new go to in Winston Salem.

detailedReviews.author: katharine lutz
detailedReviews.text: My Husband and I had the Pizzakase on Valentine‚Äôs Day. It was 8 courses and all were so delicious! I highly recommend! The pizza crust alone is easily the best I‚Äôve ever had. I can‚Äôt ever eat commercial pizza again. Reading some of the other reviews, I think some people didn‚Äôt know what to expect . It‚Äôs not your typical pizza place. We sat at the counter where we saw the food being prepared. I feel like the made the experience even more fun.

detailedReviews.author: Bradley Williams
detailedReviews.text: I attended the pizza making class this past Sunday and it was epic.  I have attended cooking classes before but this was top notch.  I had a great time. It was hands on and with a small group.  I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect but it exceeded everything that I had in my mind.  Peyton took time to answer everyone‚Äôs questions and made time for the more advanced folks along with the newbies like myself. I left more full than I have ever been and the last bite of food was just as good as the first. It was a fantastic time. Thank you MPN for being so welcoming and putting on a great class.   If you have the opportunity to take a class I highly recommend it. Also, I went in for a pizza the day before and it was delicious too.

detailedReviews.author: Barrie Podair
detailedReviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed the prefix meal for Valentine‚Äôs Day. The food was amazing and we had a wonderful experience.

detailedReviews.author: John Kaspar
detailedReviews.text: Literally the best pizza I've had in North Carolina, perhaps even on the East Coast. Pizza chef knows his trade, fairly certain he's the owner as well. Very passionate.

detailedReviews.author: Joey Skelton
detailedReviews.text: Regular seating on a Thursday (instead of the much-loved Prix fix and Pizzakase) and was amazing. Arugula salad and Brussels, chefs choice pizza, and bolognese Bianca rigatoni‚Ä¶ all perfect! Great wine, zeppolis for dessert. Service was attentive and friendly but still casual. Just a fantastic meal all around!

detailedReviews.author: mason003
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic little place. My wife and I ordered the chefs menu, which comes in 5 courses. Each one was stunning and came out in a very timely manner. Very well balanced flavors, and the best octopus I've ever had. Servers were kind, friendly, and explained each dish to us in an easy to understand way. Its definitely a special occasion place, but its well worth the money you spend.

detailedReviews.author: Jack Bryant
detailedReviews.text:
We are lucky to have this caliber of restaurant in our town.

Some people give this place a bad rap for being too expensive, or pretentious, but it‚Äôs just not the case.

Mission curates an experience, that while yes it comes at a cost, is still a fantastic value considering the dining experiences available.

While the a la carte and pre fixe menus are stellar in their own right, Peyton offers the best dining experience in town with the Pizzakase.

This isn‚Äôt a ‚Äòpizza place‚Äô this is fine dining experience and you‚Äôll have the best pizza of your life

detailedReviews.author: Savannah Watson
detailedReviews.text:
100/10
Got a pre fix for two, every single course down to the detail was immaculate. Highest of food quality created with true passion. Will be back asap

detailedReviews.author: Lois Stokes
detailedReviews.text: Food is yummy but the seating process was too terrible to make up for it.  We were told a few minutes max 45 minutes.  It took over an hour.  When my husband who has a foot injury tried to sit in an unused stool, he was told he was not allowed to sit.  It was clear during our 1 hour wait that the maitre de' was stressed but I didn't think he would take it out on us.  When I explained that my husband had a foot issue and couldn't stand for long periods of time, the guy at the front told us there were no exceptions and he was upset my husband had used the chair without asking.  Too bad, like I said, the food is decent.  We won't be back after being treated so rudely.  Also, to be clear, wait staff was competent and not the issue.

detailedReviews.author: Riley Kammer
detailedReviews.text: Really awesome pizza and atmosphere.

detailedReviews.author: Brian Leysath
detailedReviews.text: Pizzakase is an amazing experience with wonderful food.  Really enjoyed the personal experience and the variety of dishes served.

detailedReviews.author: Anna Murphy
detailedReviews.text: Our group of 4 adults went for the Prix Fixe dinner.  First off, service was great but I did not like an included 20% gratuity.  For only a party of 4 please let me decide how much gratuity to give based on the service I receive.  Secondly - on a bill that is nearly $100 per person, please give me a clean plate for each course and an extra napkin on the table to set my dirty silverware between courses.  Some of the courses had sauces and dressings and my next course was sitting on top of all of those flavors left over on my plate.  We only received one plate change and a separate dish for dessert, but my dessert spoon was laid directly on the table with no napkin underneath.  First course was a salad, second was stuffed mussels, third was seared tuna, fourth was one personal sized pizza to share between the four of us, and then a dessert for each of us.  It was not an appropriate amount of food when you compared similar dishes from the menu to what we paid per person.  We should have just stopped in for a pizza and not done the prix fixe - there was no value to the ‚Äòexperience‚Äô.  I enjoyed the surprise of what was served and the food was pretty good, but was I blown away or would I return, no.

detailedReviews.author: Steve Dollase
detailedReviews.text: Inspired Italian cuisine! We had 2 pizzas‚Ä¶both among the best we‚Äôve ever had. Brown butter gnocchi was divine with a light, puffy texture. Amazing Brussels sprouts app. Panna cotta was perfection! Wow!

detailedReviews.author: Jay Saydlowski
detailedReviews.text: Great Pizza, great people

detailedReviews.author: Jay Springthorpe
detailedReviews.text: We went and did their Pizzakase experience. It was absolutely wonderful! Everything that was made for us tasted amazing. We were served a variety of dishes ranging from salad, pizza, and pasta. It was nice to also not have to choose just one dish. It was also fun to sit at the bar in front of the chefs and talk to them about the dishes that are being served. I would highly recommend this experience to anybody that is looking for something different for a night out.

detailedReviews.author: Ed Prater
detailedReviews.text: Awesome experience and terrific food

detailedReviews.author: Keith Volpe
detailedReviews.text: This is the ONE place I know in Winston Salem serving authentic pizza Italiana üáÆüáπ Certainly not Cugino Forno! ü§Æ If you like the food, show some love and buy the kitchen a round of beers üçª

detailedReviews.author: Katherine Schantz
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely NOT WORTH anything more than a pizza

detailedReviews.author: Leah Guzman
detailedReviews.text:
They do NOT accept take out orders. No exceptions. Extremely disappointed, I‚Äôve been in the hospital for almost a week and tried to send someone to place a pickup and they refused to take the order, and even let them know the situation. I will not be giving them my business in the future, and I do not care how good the pizza is if they‚Äôre this heartless.

If they‚Äôre too busy to be open to the public, then they should just shut it down.

detailedReviews.author: Paul Haverly
detailedReviews.text: I hate giving bad reviews but when you tell your guests they can‚Äôt get a plain cheese pizza there is an assumption that we should trust the chef‚Äôs creativity and skill and you‚Äôll thank us later.  Unfortunately this was not the case.  The soppresata pie was essentially strips of deli salami with mixed greens which could have been rescued by a proper crust.  Regrettably the dough wasn‚Äôt fermented long enough as evidenced by the lack of color on the bottom and the pizza was cooked too quickly in the hottest part of the oven.  The result was an undercooked middle  with speckles of char around the crust.  A big letdown for the lofty price

detailedReviews.author: Kelsey Huffman
detailedReviews.text: We love Mission Pizza! This year for our anniversary finding a place to eat was more challenging due to my dietary limitations for a new allergy. The staff/kitchen was well aware of what I could and couldn‚Äôt eat and if our server was unsure he would check with the kitchen first. I haven‚Äôt been able to eat out much so it was a nice change of pace and Mission Pizza didn‚Äôt disappoint. The arugula salad and Burrata were my favorites but everything was delicious!

detailedReviews.author: Wendy Browne
detailedReviews.text: We were immediately transported to Florence. The tasting menu was incredible. Make your reservations now!

detailedReviews.author: Karem RDL
detailedReviews.text: Zeppoles are the best.

detailedReviews.author: Liam Bowman
detailedReviews.text:
We got a reservation for the prix fixe menu and every item felt like something I could not get anywhere else. The items ranged from comfort food to a truly unique experience. On top of the excellent food, the service was exceptional and very attentive.

The prix fixe menu was excellent and a great way to get a reservation but I have come in the past for just the pizza and left incredibly satisfied.

I would and am recommending this restaurant and the prix fixe menu to anyone that will listen.

detailedReviews.author: JOSEPHINE LOCAL
detailedReviews.text:
I grew up on Italian food.
Pizza & pasta were served a few times a week.

As a top Google Guide with over 133 Million views on maps, I‚Äôm often invited to come eat & provide an opinion to chefs. I‚Äôm not going to lie, we are a bit spoiled. My husband also enjoys being my companion on these food trips. He (is quite the chef) so he also offers his opinion on the dishes &  the service. It‚Äôs an adventure!

We were at the NC Zoo, yesterday & googled places to eat near Winston Salem & Mission came up. After reading a bit about being James Beard Semi-Finalists, it Intrigued us, so we drove around an hour to get here.

We ordered a pizza, two Pellegrinos, my husband got a beer, we also went with a Lobster fennel pasta & the broccolini.

Here‚Äôs the family consensus, you may disagree but we all agreed on the following:
For the money, the pizza should be bigger. It was good, yes, but $25 for a Soppresata pizza that barely feeds two‚Ä¶..Truthfully, that‚Äôs too much. Please note: All 3 of us agreed on that.

The lobster pasta with fennel was very tasty üëåIn fact, hands down, my favorite of the visit. And last, the Broccolini was okay.

If we happen to be in the area again, I might want to try more off the menu. Check them out for yourself &
Buon Appetito üç¥

Josephine Local Guide

detailedReviews.author: Tom Olinger
detailedReviews.text: The website says that they close at 9:30pm.  That‚Äôs BS.  We went Sat Sept 14 ‚Äò24 and they closed at 8:30!   ‚ÄúKnocked on the glass door until someone came and told us that they closed because it was at the managers discretion.  Poor way to run a restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Wes Neal
detailedReviews.text: My wife and I go to Mission anytime we have a special meal or just want to feel special. We celebrated my brother‚Äôs birthday last month, and it was his first time. He was blown away. Can‚Äôt say enough good things.

detailedReviews.author: Joe Oldham
detailedReviews.text: We tried the pizzakase on our first visit. Wow. Pricey but worth it. Requires a reservation. We arrived a little early. Sat at the bar. Bartender very knowledgeable on their wine. MPN is better for wine than beer but the beer is mostly local and good too. The pizzakase was exceptional. Attentive staff, interacting with the chefs, a great atmosphere at a counter - like omakase in a sushi place. We were served two exceptional salads, the second centered around crab and peach, interleaved with pieces of neopolitan pizza. The first was a cacio e pepe pizza that was outstanding, and it just got better. Dessert was a generous and delicious chocolate panna cotta. I went in kind of skeptical, and left thinking it was worth every penny. Will be back to try the price fixed and repeat the pizzakase.

detailedReviews.author: Otis Bertram
detailedReviews.text: Went to MPN for the first time last night and had reservations for the pizzakase with wine pairing. What a great evening and experience. All of the food was incredible, and the pizza is amazing. The chef/owner is a master at pizza making. Out of this world flavor. Highly recommend the pizzakase reservation because you get to try so many different things and we had four different pizzas (including a deep fried pizza dough pizza) along with multiple other dishes and everything is excellent. The rosemary dessert phenomenal as well. Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough, the best.

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Pick
detailedReviews.text: Just outstanding!! Go!! Now!! Amazing creativity on the prix fixe 5 course menu. The wine pairings were great, too.

detailedReviews.author: Mike Forno
detailedReviews.text: Unbelievable!!!  Took a trip from Raleigh to WS with a crew for the Pizzakase experience.  I think it has ruined me...  I can't imagine eating pizza any other way now.  Absolutely worth the trip, I will do it again, hopefully soon.

detailedReviews.author: Steve Mangano
detailedReviews.text: Mission Pizza never disappoints.  It is simply the best pizza in the south and if you have the opportunity to reserve a pizzakese experience do it!  I have driven over 2hours to get here and go a few times a year with new groups of friends.  Everyone loves it and agrees it is absolutely magical.  If you are a pizza fanatic then this is simply a must.  In any big city, lines would be around the block.

detailedReviews.author: Loco Jay
detailedReviews.text:
We did the tasting course. It was a great experience. All the different types of pizza we tried were Delicious--some more interesting than others. It turned out to be more food than expected despite eating a slice a course. There were two salad courses and one chicken course in addition to four pizzas. Only thing that was underwhelming was the Pana Cotta for dessert. It was just ok.

If was a great experience and I'm glad I did it but it's a one time visit for me. I'll stick to paying $10 for a large pizza at domino's (JK).

detailedReviews.author: Mysha Sissine
detailedReviews.text: Dreamy pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Raymond Haigney II, DDS, FACS
detailedReviews.text: Outstanding dining experience. I went with 3 other colleagues. We had an amazing tasting experience. Complements to the chef!

detailedReviews.author: Megan Szczukowski
detailedReviews.text: We did the prix fixe menu with wine pairing. We were definitely served the pairings incorrectly. Sangiovese with a seafood pasta and a sparkling rose with pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Faith Castellano
detailedReviews.text: We were visiting Winston-Salem and decided to stop here for dinner. There was a 30 minute wait which we agreed to and then were told it would an additional hour. By the time we were seated, we were really hungry. They were out of two apps that we wanted so we settled for a salad and pizza. The arugula salad was so dry. I normally go very light on my dressing but this was like eating grass. We also got the burrata pizza and it was very bland.

detailedReviews.author: Jason A
detailedReviews.text: We had the Pizzakasse at the bar with the wine pairings.  If you get a craving for pizza, you should treat yourself and go all in for the pizzakasse.  You are at the mercy of Chef's creative diabolical notions with a very thought out wine pairing.    Sit, come hungry, You'll have a great time!

detailedReviews.author: Liz Williams
detailedReviews.text: Truly the best pasta dish I have ever had! We did the pre fixe menu and everything was phenomenal but the pasta was out of this world.

detailedReviews.author: Lis Harvey
detailedReviews.text: Great date place. Consistently spectacular food. Unassuming, affordable, sexy. Prixe fixe on Thursday last included a deep arugula salad with fennel and prosciutto, a mussel dish that had me slurping up the extra broth, and a juicy version of linguine alle vongole (fresh clams, perfectly cooked) with some kind of irresistible crunchy magic that had me LICKING the outside of the damn shells. There was a basil ‚Äònduja pizza that slapped, and an unusual dessert for NC‚Äî a lux combo of burrata, herbs, and blistered peaches. It was gorgeous. Wine pairings were spot on. Wait staff, spot on. As always, we look forward to eating here again. Hard to believe this restaurant exists outside Berkeley or Brooklyn. Excited for Asheville and the sister-concept MPN joint that just opened at Terra Nova Beer Co‚Ä¶

detailedReviews.author: d m
detailedReviews.text: great spot, a must when in WS

detailedReviews.author: WILLIAM MEDINA
detailedReviews.text: Pizza was truly outstanding plus my daughter had a wonderful vegetarian dish that she thoroughly enjoyed. Will be back.

detailedReviews.author: David Boraks
detailedReviews.text: Great dining experience. We went for the adventure and weren't disappointed. The chef heard us chatting about food and places and riffed on what he heard. The wine selections  were good we met new friends as we sat at the bar.

detailedReviews.author: Enzo Morgan
detailedReviews.text: La miglior pizza di tutta Winston-Salem vera pizza napoletana

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.0/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the unique and immersive "Pizzakase" experience, which includes multiple courses and detailed explanations of each dish's inspiration and ingredients. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The restaurant is praised for using high-quality, thoughtfully sourced ingredients, including local produce and imported specialties, which elevate the authenticity and flavor of their dishes. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility

The ambiance and atmosphere are consistently described as inviting and conducive to conversation, making it a perfect spot for date nights and special occasions. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues, particularly concerning customer service and reservation confusion - review management can address this concern
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness, with complaints about the restaurant's dark and uninviting environment - social media marketing can improve this area
Poor online visibility and confusing website navigation, leading to reservation issues - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

positive.author: Rachel Qualliotine
positive.text: Hands down the best food around. I went to uncsa from ‚Äã2007-11 and considered Winston Salem to be a food desert. When I moved back in 2023 I was told to go to Mission not knowing what to expect. I ordered the bucatini all'amatriciana and it was so delicious I almost cried. I could not believe that I was eating something so incredible in WS - there was actual guanciale, the pasta was cooked al dente, the flavor, the temperature, the portion size, everything was perfect. Of course the pizza is fantastic, I could eat it every day, but don‚Äôt stop there ! Try the prix fixe, the pizzakase, the specials. Every ingredient is sourced thoughtfully, locally if possible, and served fresh. ‚ÄãD‚Äãon't forget to check out the Baller wine section, you‚Äôll find things there you won‚Äôt anywhere else‚Äã and sometimes they're 20% off. This place is a true gem and we are so lucky to have it in WS.

neutral.author: Andrea Kozak
neutral.text:
First of all, the service and ambience was phenomenal. Our server  explained each course of the prix fixe in depth & answered any questions we had. The first appetizer (we ordered one prior to choosing the prix fixe route) was amazing, and the first 2 courses were very good. The peaches , tomatoes and mussels were so fresh.
The pizza was too doughy imo and didn‚Äôt have enough sauce where I felt the dough over powered the course, which I was a little bummed because it did sound like a great pizza. The dessert was just mid.

Would definitely like to try other pizzas on the menu and more of the seafood options.

neutral.author: Zgriffin
neutral.text: We went in around 5:30 with my fianc√© and got the prix fixe our service was phenomenal and our waitress was incredibly knowledgeable on all of our courses. All of our courses were great aside from, funny enough, the pizza was just not great. I expected more as we enjoyed the rest of the courses. If I were to go back I would select a pasta dish along with another pizza to see if it was maybe the chefs choice of that day.

neutral.author: Sam Griffith
neutral.text: Some of the best dough I've ever had, but everything else is a letdown. Toppings, atmosphere, and service don't rise to the highs of the dough. Overall it doesn't meet the hype, but it's alright.

negative.author: Paige O'Byrne
negative.text: We were recommended this restaurant as a great place to get pizza, and wow! It was very yawn worthy. 26 dollars for a pizza that is not 12", not 16", but some random size that you can't eat by yourself nor share with anyone. If you are the type that enjoys paying triple the price you should pay, you will love the menu that is forced down your throat.. No substitutions, come on. Fennel is gross but you still make me eat it! Un b leevable

negative.author: Emmanuel Gilbert
negative.text:
We tried the pizzakase menu (6 shared courses + wine pairing) and unfortunately left feeling very underwhelmed for the price ‚Äî our bill was $334 for two.

The concept is a play on Japanese omakase, which we were excited about, but the execution fell short. Most of the meal was predominantly bread: salad ‚Üí whole pizza ‚Üí half pizza ‚Üí pasta ‚Üí whole pizza ‚Üí dessert (two chunks of watermelon). While the food itself was okay, it wasn‚Äôt anything special, and the value just wasn‚Äôt there.

The wine pairing was disappointing, and we later realized we could have ordered everything individually from the menu for less than the set price. Service also felt awkward ‚Äî instead of thoughtful stories or inspiration for each dish (as advertised), we were just given a quick list of ingredients, with little enthusiasm. It didn‚Äôt feel like the intimate, passionate omakase-style experience it was trying to be.

They make decent pizza, but trying to deliver a tasting menu/omakase experience just isn‚Äôt their strength ‚Äî they‚Äôd be better off focusing on what they do well. To top it off, a 20% gratuity was automatically added and then we were prompted to tip on top of that. Overall, not worth the cost or the hype.

negative.author: M. D.
negative.text: Racist place. Old white guy told us brown people to ‚Äúcheck your wallet‚Äù before we went inside. Then the waitress said couldn‚Äôt seat our table of 5 because too busy. But half the restaurant was empty.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
